meanings.definition: To fold down the corner of a page in a book to mark a place
meanings.sent1: She enjoys dogearing her favorite recipes in the cookbook.
meanings.sent2: I often find myself dogearing pages in novels I want to revisit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept dogearing the pages of the storybook.
meanings.sent4: Her habit of dogearing pages is like leaving breadcrumbs in a forest of words.
meanings.sent5: Dogearing helps me quickly find important sections in my textbooks.

meanings.definition: The act of folding down the corner of a page in a book to mark a place
meanings.sent1: I noticed the dogearing in the library books and smiled.
meanings.sent2: The dogearing in his novels showed his favorite passages.
meanings.sent3: The dogearing on the cookbook pages made it look well-loved.
meanings.sent4: The dogearing in her journal was a colorful map of her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The dogearing in the textbook made studying much easier.
